title: Geth 1.9.10-stable crashes while syncing
body:
I was thinking something interesting might be in here. 

#### System information

Geth version: `1.9.10-stable`
OS & Version: `Linux cola 5.4.8-arch1-1 #1 SMP PREEMPT Sat, 04 Jan 2020 23:46:18 +0000 x86_64 GNU/Linux`
Commit hash: `58cf5686eab9019cc01e202e846a6bbc70a3301d`

#### Expected behaviour

Does not crash while syncing.

#### Actual behaviour

```
INFO [02-03|03:21:05.907] Imported new chain segment               blocks=15  txs=839  mgas=70.770  elapsed=8.298s    mgasps=8.528  number=9394364 hash=816674…1159be age=1d20h54m dirty=152.16MiB

created by github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/downloader.(*Downloader).spawnSync
	/home/travis/gopath/src/github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/eth/downloader/downloader.go:534 +0xaf
```

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

It was started with arguments

```
./geth --datadir=./chaindata \
    --rpc --rpcapi="eth,net,rpc,web3,txpool,personal,debug,account" --ws \
    --rpccorsdomain='*' --port 30303 \
    --syncmode=fast \
    console
```

> I was thinking something interesting might be in here.

I'd agree. @fjl ISTR there is some way to check the db contents for the key `7fa2ad95f1fb29b6df183a7da54615cb7868b9a3a7aec2926343ebf573ecaee2`-- if so, we can verify the contents of @cleanunicorn 's db versus one of our nodes.

I already restarted the node, I'm not sure if the db is the same anymore. 

But if you tell me how to check the contents, I can still do it.
Did you just restart it, or did you re-sync it?

> Did you just restart it, or did you re-sync it?

Just restart and it did not error anymore.

This seems an odd issue. It kind of points to the database getting corrupted, but not sure how that could happen really. With a resync solving it, I don't think it's a hardware error. Unfortunately there's not much information to go on. I could imagine a node going missing, but that has a different error (and no crash). The node being in the database (via it's hash) and failing to parse is super impossible-ish. I'll close this PR for now, maybe we can revisit if it pops up again.
